Interested in being an organizer?.answer: Applications to be an organizer open around September–October at the beginning of the school year before Bitcamp!

Interested in hacking?.answer: Please fill out this form to be notified when our registrations open: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScISWbfoN-tbEwNN-1z0_GFOd8gZjSwJZuFqvwfkTuQKB6Bcg/viewform

Interested in sponsoring us?.answer: Please check out more information at: https://bit.camp/sponsor

What does Bitcamp look like?.answer: Here is a recap video that encapsulates what you will experience during the weekend: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5AL9sNhZgE

What/When is Bitcamp?.answer: Bitcamp falls in the 2nd week of April and takes place from Friday–Saturday.

What's a hackathon?.answer: A hackathon is a time-bound event where individuals or teams collaborate to solve a specific problem, often by creating a working prototype or new product within a short timeframe.

Do I have to be experienced to attend?.answer: No, beginners are welcome and encouraged!

Is it okay if I don't have an idea or te.answer: Yes that's totally fine! We will have a team formation event to help you find teammates.

Can I attend if I'm a minor (under 18)?.answer: Yes, but there are additional forms/waivers that must be filled out.

Can I attend if I don't want to hack?.answer: Of course! TThere are tons of events, workshops, and networking opportunities for students who don't want to hack.

How else can I get involved without hack.answer: You can apply to be an organizer next year around September/October, host a workshop, or register as a mentor/volunteer.

How do I join a team?.answer: Teams of 1–4 can be formed before or at Bitcamp and will be reflected on Devpost.

How competitive is the application?.answer: There is no application to attend Bitcamp as a hacker.

Who can apply to organize Bitcamp?.answer: Any UMD undergraduate students are eligible to apply! No previous hackathon experience is required.

Is Bitcamp free?.answer: Yes! Bitcamp is fully free to attend.

Can non-registered people attend?.answer: Yes. People that haven’t registered can show up after a designated time in-person to pick up a waitlist number and then may be able to attend depending on headcount.

What have people made in the past?.answer: You can check out last year’s projects here https://bitcamp2025.devpost.com/!

What hardware is available?.answer: The specified hardware that will be available is not determined yet, but we will have multiple options available for our hackers.

Is there travel reimbursement?.answer: Yes, we offer travel reimbursement depending on the constraints.

Do I need to wear a mask?.answer: Masks are not required unless you have an infectious illness.

Is travel reimbursement guaranteed, and.answer: Due to a limited budget, we're unable to guarantee reimbursement, nor can we guarantee full reimbursement on travel expenses. Please do not depend on the travel reimbursement when planning your trip.

Where can I access the reimbursement app.answer: We will be sending out the application for travel reimbursement through email for those who expressed interest in the Bitcamp registration form.

What kind of transportation is eligible.answer: We will consider reimbursing public transportation, rideshare, and interstate transportation (train/plane). However, it is important to note that due to a limited budget, public transportation is encouraged and is most likely to be reimbursed!

When will I hear back about my reimburse.answer: You will hear back within 3-4 business days regarding your reimbursement decision.

How will I receive my reimbursement?.answer: Reimbursements will be provided at the event, and hackers must be present in person to receive the reimbursement.

How many people per team?.answer: Up to 4 people can form a team.

Can I leave the venue and come back?.answer: YAs long as you have your wristband signifying you checked in, then yes!

How does judging work?.answer: Judging occurs during Expo and is conducted by organizers or sponsors.

Where can I sleep?.answer: You are able to sleep on your desk sitting up, but you are not allowed to lie down due to potential hazards

What is the WiFi password?.answer: You can join the free UMD guest wifi, or join via your UID using Eduroam if you’re a UMD Student!

Are snacks available?.answer: Yes there will be a food table during weekend of. We will provide you with meals, and there will be a snack table.
